data.question: What is the chemical formula of the copper(II) chlorate complex that showed excellent initiation of PETN?
data.answer: The chemical formula is not explicitly mentioned in the text for the specific complex that showed excellent initiation of PETN.

data.question: Which copper(II) chlorate complex has the highest decomposition temperature?
data.answer: Complex 2 has the highest decomposition temperature at 186 °C.

data.question: Is compound 9 sensitive to laser ignition?
data.answer: No, compound 9 showed deflagration instead of detonation in the laser ignition tests.

data.question: What is the impact sensitivity of compound 3 according to the BAM drophammer?
data.answer: The impact sensitivity of compound 3 is 3 J.

data.question: Which compound has the lowest density among the copper(II) chlorate complexes?
data.answer: Compound 6 has the lowest density at 1.711 g cm−3.

data.question: Did compound 2 show positive DDT towards PETN in the copper shell initiation tests?
data.answer: Yes, compound 2 showed positive DDT towards PETN.

data.question: What is the coordination environment of copper in compound 4?
data.answer: In compound 4, the copper is in a square pyramidal coordination environment.

data.question: Can the copper(II) chlorate complexes be considered as promising compounds for laser ignition?
data.answer: Yes, the copper(II) chlorate complexes are considered promising for laser ignition due to their response in the laser ignition tests.

data.question: What is the friction sensitivity of compound 8 according to the BAM friction tester?
data.answer: The friction sensitivity of compound 8 is less than 5 N.

data.question: Which compound showed the lowest electrostatic discharge sensitivity?
data.answer: Compound 5 showed the lowest electrostatic discharge sensitivity at 50 mJ.

data.question: Is compound 10 considered toxic based on the EC50 value?
data.answer: Toxicity data for compound 10 is not provided, so its toxicity cannot be determined from the given information.

data.question: What method was used for the absorption correction in the X-ray diffraction analysis?
data.answer: The empirical absorption correction using spherical harmonics, implemented in SCALE3 ABSPACK scaling algorithm, was used.

data.question: Did all copper(II) chlorate complexes show absorption maxima close to 350 and 600 nm in the UV-Vis spectra?
data.answer: Yes, all copper(II) chlorate complexes showed absorption maxima close to 350 and 600 nm.

data.question: What is the crystal system of compound 6?
data.answer: The crystal system of compound 6 is trigonal.

data.question: Which compound was proven to have lower toxicity towards aquatic life compared to its copper(II) perchlorate counterpart?
data.answer: Compound 3 was proven to have lower toxicity towards aquatic life compared to its copper(II) perchlorate counterpart.

data.question: What is the main goal in the synthesis of metal chlorate complexes as mentioned in the text?
data.answer: The main goal in the synthesis of metal chlorate complexes is the stabilization of the desired products.

data.question: Are the copper(II) chlorate complexes described as thermally stable?
data.answer: Yes, the copper(II) chlorate complexes are described as thermally stable with decomposition temperatures above 150 °C for most compounds.

data.question: Which compound forms a 2D-network due to its bridging ligands?
data.answer: Compound 10 forms a 2D-network due to its bridging ligands.

data.question: What is the role of nitrogen-rich ligands in the synthesis of copper(II) chlorate complexes?
data.answer: The nitrogen-rich ligands are used for stabilization and tuning of the energetic character of the copper(II) chlorate complexes.

data.question: Is the laser initiation mechanism of copper(II) chlorate complexes fully understood?
data.answer: No, the laser initiation mechanism of copper(II) chlorate complexes is not fully understood.
